page.title: 19Brisley Village Hall
page.content:
Brisley Village Hall is on the lane leading from the Patch.It was built in 1950 and it belongs to the village. It is run by a committee.
It is made of red brick and has a grey asbestos roof.The hall has a stage at one end with changing rooms. At the other end there is a kitchen, which is used to serve refreshments and drinks, and some toilets.
To raise money for the hall, the committee collects old newspapers, runs children's discos, Country and Western dances and bingo.
The hall can also be hired. It is used for the Women's Institute, wedding receptions, discos and for refreshments after the carol service in church.
